clinical_study.brief_title: Accelerated Vaccination Schedule Against Hepatitis B Virus With Combined Hepatitis A and B Vaccine Among Hemodialysis Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Accelerated Vaccination Schedule Against Hepatitis B Virus With Combined Hepatitis A and B Vaccine Among Hemodialysis Patients, Does it Works?

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to examine the result of seroprotection using the accelerated vaccination schedule in vaccination of hemodialysis patient through using combined hepatitis A and B vaccine.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Patient seuentially randomized to either vaccine

primary_outcome.measure: Hepatitis B virus Seroprotection after one month
primary_outcome.time_frame: one month after third dose of the vaccine
primary_outcome.description: Hepatitis B virus surface antibodies titer after one month

primary_outcome.measure: Hepatitis B virus Seroprotection after three months
primary_outcome.time_frame: three months after third dose of the vaccine
primary_outcome.description: Hepatitis B virus surface antibodies titer after three month

secondary_outcome.description: The proportion of fever among patients in both arms
Visual pain scale for pain from injection

arm_group.description: Each Hepatitis B recombinant DNA vaccine vial contained 20 microgram of vaccine dose. Two vials will be intramuscularly injected one vial in each deltoid muscle on months zero, one, two and six.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Combined hepatitis A and B vaccine
arm_group.description: Each one-milliliter dose of vaccine contains 720 ELISA units of inactivated hepatitis A virus and 20 mcg of recombinant HBsAg protein. One dose of vaccine also contains 0.45 mg of aluminum. Two vials will be intramuscularly injected one vial in each deltoid muscle on on days zero, seven, and 21.

intervention.description: either Hepatitis B recombinant DNA vaccine or Combined hepatitis A and B vaccine given to the patients
intervention.arm_group_label: Combined hepatitis A and B vaccine

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age was above 18 years
- Hemodialysis patient
- All patients had undetectable hepatitis B virus surface antigen and antibody
Exclusion Criteria:
- A positive serum hepatitis B virus surface antigen and antibody
- patient received a previous course of hepatitis B virus vaccine

responsible_party.investigator_title: MD. - Lecturer at Internal Medicine Department- Faculty of Medicine
